description:
Unitywater operates in one of the fastest growing regions of Australia, providing essential water supply and sewerage services to residents and businesses in the Moreton Bay, Sunshine Coast and Noosa regions. Unitywater’s core business is the delivery of drinking and recycled water to customers and the collection and treatment of sewage and trade waste. 

​​

Women represent 36% of Unitywater’s Executive Leadership team and Board, and there is a strong focus on fostering an environment where women are supported to pursue rewarding careers along with personal and professional commitments.

Unitywater promotes flexibility and works hard to create better ways of working for all staff through job-sharing, part-time roles and technology-enabled flexibility. Many of Unitywater’s staff and leaders practice flexible working, and the organisation is committed to building an inclusive and supportive work environment that enables its people to achieve a balance that’s right for them.


Unitywater is a multi-award winning industry leader that fosters innovation and the use of new technologies. It also provides staff with opportunities to work on a wide range of exciting and challenging projects that break new ground in the industry and deliver a better service for their customers. Despite its commercial focus, the business has a strong commitment to grassroots community support through sponsorships, fundraising and volunteering, giving its employees the chance to give back to their local communities.
